title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
A Technology article on Wednesday about Google quoted remarks on artificial intelligence made by Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Sundar Pichai to a Brussels think tank last year. In some editions, the article incorrectly said he made the remarks last week.

---

In some editions Wednesday, a Page One article about Microsoft Corp.'s earnings incorrectly referred to Kyle Vikstrom, a director of investor relations at the company, as Mr. Vikstrom instead of Ms. on second reference.

---

Rabobank is based in Utrecht, the Netherlands. An article in the Business & Finance section on Wednesday about banks rewarding commodities producers for carbon curbs incorrectly said it is based in Amsterdam.

(See: "Commodities: Banks Reward Green Borrowers" -- WSJ Jan. 27, 2021)

---

Newsletter platform Revue Holding BV competes in the growing content-creation space with other startups such as Substack Inc. and Rocket Science Group LLC's Mailchimp. In some editions Wednesday, a Technology article about Twitter Inc.'s deal to buy Revue incorrectly referred to Sinocism LLC, a user of Substack, as one such startup.

---

Notice to readers

Wall Street Journal staff members are working remotely during the pandemic. For the foreseeable future, please send reader comments only by email or phone, using the contacts below, not via U.S. Mail.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
